documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
Privacy Policy

Further, Inc. (“Further Food”) is committed to protecting your privacy online and to keeping you informed of your online rights. Please read the following information carefully and check back periodically as this information may change. This Privacy Policy (“Policy”) applies to the website, content, products and services of Further Food (collectively, the “Further Food Products and Services”). Third party websites, applications and services you may access via the Further Food Products and Services are not subject to this Policy and may have their own privacy policies. We recommend that you read the privacy policy or notice of any such third party website, application or service to find out how they protect and/or handle your personal information.

What Information Further Food Collects:

1. Information you provide Further Food directly: While you may visit the Further Food website without providing personal information, in order to fully utilize all of the functionalities and other content of Further Food’s Products and Services, you may be asked to register for an account in which Further Food will require certain personal information. Such personal information required or requested for registration may include, but shall not be limited to: name. gender. birth date. physical and electronic address(es). telephone number(s). occupation or specialty. mobile device(s) owned and/or being used to access the Further Food Products and Services. Further Food user name and password. Further Food collects and may use your content submissions, reviews and ratings, your search queries, preferences, downloads and purchases attempted or made.

2. Information Further Food collects automatically through your usage: Further Food may have and utilize capabilities to automatically collect certain information about you through your navigation and use of the Further Food Products and Services. This type of information includes your browsing activity and behavior, such as other websites you visit and advertisements you exhibit interest in, as well as cookies and other technologies. Information about your computer or device may also be collected automatically.

3. Information Further Food collects through other means: Further Food may have certain relationships with third parties such as advertisers, marketing groups, online social networks, or product developers which are featured through the Further Food Products and Services, from which Further Food may obtain information about you. Further Food may also collect data through your use of third party products acquired from Further Food. The information collected through such means may include location, demographic, and other personal information about you.

Rakuten Advertising, a third party we partner with, may collect personal information when you interact with our website, including IP addresses, digital identifiers, information about your web browsing and app usage and how you interact with our properties and ads for a variety of purposes, such as personalization of offers or advertisements, analytics about how you engage with websites or ads and other commercial purposes. For more information about the collection, use and sale of your personal data and your rights, please use the below links.

Privacy policy : https://rakutenadvertising.com/legal-notices/services-privacy-policy/

Your rights : https://rakutenadvertising.com/legal-notices/services-privacy-rights-request-form/

How Further Food Uses the Information: Further Food may use your personal information to fulfill requests you make regarding our services, programs, products and offerings, and to offer you other services, programs, products and offerings that Further Food has reason to believe may be of interest to you. Further Food may also use your personal information to communicate with you about your account, your usage, any user submissions you generate, including content reviews, ratings, forum posts or other content. In the event that you choose to submit reviews, ratings, forum posts or other content, Further Food may publish information you provide us, such as your name, condition, affiliation(s), and any area(s) of specialty alongside your review, rating, post or other content. Further Food may use your personal information to notify you by mail (physical or electronic) of special offers, modifications to any agreements you are a party to, and any related newsletters. Further Food may also utilize your personal information to enforce and/or convey legal terms and notifications pertaining to Further Food and your usage.

Information Sharing and Disclosure: In the event that Further Food needs or chooses to share your personal information with a third party, Further Food will take any and all reasonably necessary steps to ensure that it does so safely and securely. Further Food may share your personal information with trusted partners in order to provide you with the services of Further Food, or effectively share offers with you from Further Food or one of our trusted partners, but only those with which Further Food has executed confidentiality agreements. Further Food may collect, use and sell your personal information to third parties other than trusted partners on an aggregated and blinded basis only. The sharing of your personal data required for any transaction you attempt will be done securely, only with the third parties necessary to execute the transaction, and Further Food will request that such third parties treat your personal information appropriately. Further Food may also share your information if required by law or to respond to a legal request. In the event that Further Food’s corporate ownership structure should change, your personal information may be transferred to a successor organization, or subject to different terms. Any individual that Further Food authorizes to have access to, or control of, your personal information shall be required to protect it in a manner consistent with this Policy and said individual does not have the permission to use your information in any manner which is inconsistent with this Policy or outside the scope of the role Further Food intended for them.

Security of Personal Information: Further Food is very concerned about safeguarding the confidentiality of your personally identifiable information. To do that, Further Food employs administrative, physical and electronic measures designed to protect your information from unauthorized access. While Further Food cannot guarantee total security of your personal information, it can assure you that it implements safety measures which are standard in the industry. In the event any of the security measures are breached, Further Food will promptly make any legally-required disclosures of any breach of security, confidentiality, or integrity of your unencrypted electronically stored personal data to you via email or conspicuous posting on the website consistent with the reasonable needs of law enforcement or any measures necessary to determine the scope of the breach and restore the reasonable integrity of the data system.

Accessing and Updating Your Personal Information: Further Food maintains the personal information which is identifiable to you. At your request, you may have access to this information for your review and modification. If you want to request any of your personal information that is maintained by Further Food, and subsequently, if there are any corrections you desire to make, please contact Further Food at the address listed below. You may also delete your Further Food account, which will result in the removal of some, but not all, of your personal information from Further Food’s records.

Cookies and Other Technologies:  Further Food may use cookies or other electronic technologies to collect information about you for purposes of improving the Further Food Products and Services and your user experience.  This includes storing your searches and results, preferences, browsing techniques and behavior, which are captured through the use of cookies.  Further Food may also implement cookies in the course of advertising.  All information collected through the use of cookies will be handled in accordance with this Policy.  If you wish, you may choose to disable cookies on your browser, however, please understand that disabling cookies may limit the functionality of the Further Food Products and Services and ultimately, your user experience.

Links to Third-Party Web Sites and Services:  Further Food may provide you with links to third party websites or services either directly on Further Food’s website and application or indirectly by way of products it offers.  Further Food does not have control over such third party sites or services and is not responsible for any personal information that you may provide while you are visiting or utilizing them. Further Food encourages you to read and understand the privacy policies of any third party site or service prior to deciding whether or not you wish to provide any of your personal information. In addition, third party sites may conduct their own data collection through cookies or other electronic technologies.

Children:  Further Food does not knowingly collect personal information of children under 13.  In the event that Further Food discovers that it is in possession of such information, it will take reasonable measures to delete the information.  If you have reason to believe that Further Food is in receipt of any personal information of an individual under the age of 13, please notify Further Food at the address below. Individuals under 13 should not use the Further Food Products and Services.

SMS Terms and Conditions

Please read these terms and conditions carefully. . By checking the box to sign up for the text messaging program, or opting in through some other explicit means (opting in via short code or entering your phone number into a on-site collection widget), you expressly consent to receive non-marketing and marketing text messages (also known as SMS) from Further Food and others texting on its behalf, at the telephone number(s) that you provide. . You may opt-out of these communications at any time, and consent to receive marketing text messages is not required to purchase any goods or services.  

You also accept and agree to be bound by these SMS Terms and Conditions, Further Food’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy, and any other applicable terms and agreements related to your use of Further Food’s services.

Overview: Further Food text messages are intended to provide you with information about upcoming deliveries and our goods and services (e.g., Further Food sponsored events, recipes, coupons, promotions, product launches, sweepstakes, and contests). Message frequency will vary, but you will receive a maximum of ten (10) messages per week from the Further Food text messaging program.  Message and data rates may apply to each text message sent or received in connection with Further Food text messages, as provided in your mobile telephone service rate plan (please contact your mobile telephone carrier for pricing plans), in addition to any applicable roaming charges.

How to Opt-Out: To stop receiving text messages from Further Food’s text messaging program described herein, reply STOP to any message you have received from Further Food as part of this program. You will then receive confirmation of your opt-out of that text messaging program. If you need further assistance, you can contact us at wecare@furtherfood.com.

Your Number: You represent that you are the account holder for the mobile telephone number(s) that you provide. . You are responsible for notifying Further Food immediately if you change your mobile telephone number. You may notify Further Food of a number change by emailing wecare@furtherfood.com.

You agree to indemnify Further Food in full for all claims, expenses, and damages, including third-party claims, related to or caused in whole or in part by your failure to notify Further Food of a change in your telephone number.

Eligibility, Support, Deliverability: To receive Further Food text messages, you must be a resident of the United States and 18 years of age or older. . Further Food reserves the right to require proof of age. You may receive help by emailing wecare@furtherfood.com. You understand and acknowledge that network services, including but not limited to mobile network services, are outside of Further Food’s control, and Further Food is not responsible or liable for issues arising from them.

Termination of Text Messaging: Further Food  may suspend or terminate your receipt of our text messages if Further Food believes you are in breach of these SMS Terms and Conditions. . Your receipt of Further Food text messages is also subject to termination in the event that your mobile telephone service terminates or lapses. Further Food reserves the right to modify or discontinue, temporarily or permanently, all or any part of Further Food text messages, with or without notice.

Changes to Terms and Conditions: Further Food may revise, modify, or amend these SMS Terms and Conditions at any time. You agree to review these SMS Terms and Conditions periodically to ensure that you are aware of any changes. . Your continued consent to receive Further Food text messages will indicate your acceptance of those changes.

Modifications to this Policy:  Further Food reserves the right to change this Policy at any time.  Further Food will post such modifications to its website and all changes will be effective upon posting. Your use of the Further Food Products and Services constitutes your acceptance of the terms of this Policy.

Questions regarding this Policy:  Please direct any questions or concerns regarding this Policy or its implementation to hello@furtherfood.com

The Privacy Policy was last updated: . March, 2021

Expert Spotlight Maria Emmerich

documents.name: Terms and Conditions
documents.text:
Terms and Conditions

Website Terms and Conditions

These terms and conditions (“Terms and Conditions”) between you and Further, Inc. (“Further”) govern your use of the Further website (“Website”).  Further reserves the right to modify these Terms and Conditions at any time and to impose new or additional terms or conditions on your use.  By using or visiting the Website, you indicate your agreement to these Terms and Conditions and the Privacy Policy (incorporated herein by reference). The Website is available for individuals at least thirteen (13) years of age.  You agree not to use or attempt to use the Website if you are under the age of thirteen (13). Please discontinue your use of the Website in the event that you do not agree to any of the terms of these Terms and Conditions and the Privacy Policy.  

Medical Disclaimer :
The Website, including any and all content, products, and services, is for informational purposes only and shall not constitute medical information or replace the professional advice of a medical or healthcare professional. Your use of the Website is at your sole discretion and risk. The Website and any services or products presented and sold by Further are not intended to diagnose, cure, or treat any medical or other health condition.

You acknowledge and agree that your use of any product purchased through this Website is at your sole risk. Further expressly disclaims and has no responsibility for how you use the products provided through the website, and makes no promises, guarantees, predictions of success or any claims to special experience, insight, or expertise in providing the Website. Further shall have no liability, obligation or responsibility to any person or entity for any loss, damage, injury or adverse consequence alleged to have happened directly or indirectly as a consequence of using the Further products sold on the Website or through an authorized third party distributor. Specifically, Further disclaims any implied warranties of merchantability, and fitness for any particular purpose.

Use of Content Supplied by You :
You agree that by submitting any content including but not limited to reviews, photos, comments, recipes or articles (“User Content”) or engaging in any other form of communication with Further, including electronic mail or through the Website or social media, you grant Further, its affiliates, and partners, a royalty-free, perpetual, non-exclusive, unrestricted, irrevocable, sublicensable, worldwide license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, translate, enhance, transmit, distribute, publicly perform, display, or sublicense any such User Content or communication (including your identity and information about you) in any medium (now in existence or hereinafter developed) and for any purpose, including commercial purposes, and to authorize others to do so.  Additionally, you acknowledge and agree that Further will not be required to provide any compensation to you in relation to any of your submissions, including User Content.

Further may ask you to provide your thoughts and opinions, including the request to complete one or more surveys and you may submit ideas, suggestions, documents and proposals relating to the Services or other Further products (existing and anticipated) to Further through our support, administrative console (if applicable), forum or our contact form on our website (called “feedback”).  Providing feedback is voluntary and may take many forms. By providing feedback, you acknowledge and agree that: (i) your feedback does not contain any confidential or proprietary information. (ii) Further is not under any obligation to keep such feedback confidential. (iii) Further shall be entitled to use or disclose such feedback for any purpose. (iv) Further may have the same or comparable ideas and plans in development or under consideration prior to any such feedback being provided by you. (v) your feedback automatically becomes the property of Further without any obligation of Further to you. (vi) Further will not pay you for your feedback and we are not obligated to use it nor are we obligated to provide you with a copy of your feedback. (vii) Further does not want, and you agree not to provide, feedback that violates others’ copyrights or other intellectual property rights. and (viii) you must have all rights necessary to grant the permissions in this section. In addition, please be aware that User Content and information you submit and disclose in the Website may be available publicly, including to all users of the Internet and users of the Website, so you should be mindful of personal information and other content you may not wish to post.

Third Party Content. Clinical and Medical Content :
The Website may contain hyperlinks, advertisements or content related to third party websites, products, including third party products, services or stores.  Further may even redirect you automatically to third party websites or services and your usage of such will be governed, pending your acceptance, by their additional terms and conditions or policies, if applicable.  You agree that Further is not responsible, nor shall Further be liable, for verifying the validity or accuracy of any third party material, content, products, including third party products, advertisements, websites, services or other related materials.  In addition, Further does not warrant, will not be responsible for examining or evaluating the accuracy of, and will not have any liability or responsibility for any medical information, research or clinical materials or information provided by any third party material, content, products, advertisements, websites, services or other materials or documentation.  Any medical content, services, information, advice or materials of any kind accessed through the Website is for general information or reference purposes only and shall not be relied upon or replace any professional, clinical or medical advice or judgment provided by a physician or other health care professional.  You agree that you will not use any third party materials or any services in a manner that would infringe upon or violate the rights of any other party and that Further is not in any way responsible for any such use by you.

Permissions and Restrictions. Your Conduct :
Further grants you permission to access and use the Website as set forth in these Terms and Conditions, provided that you do not use or attempt to use the Website in any manner inconsistent with or that would violate these Terms and Conditions, or any other policy or agreement referenced herein, as applicable.  In using the Website, your conduct must, at all times comply with all relevant laws, rules, and regulations, including all applicable federal, state, and local laws (and international laws, if applicable). Further may permit individuals to submit multiple forms of content (“User Content”) in certain areas of the Website, including but not limited to recipes, photos, articles and discussion forums.  In order to engage in the Website, you must agree to abide by the following rules of usage of the Website:

1. You acknowledge that any User Content you submit will be considered non-confidential and Further Food has no obligation to treat such User Content as confidential, except that Further will maintain such User Content in accordance with its Privacy Policy.

2. You will not transmit false information through the Website. You may not impersonate, imitate or pretend to be somebody else when using the Website. You are responsible for all use of the Website by you and by those you allow to use, or provide access to, the Website.  

3. You may not provide to or post on or through the Website any User Content that constitutes junk mail, spam, advertising, and/or commercial offers. You may not repeat the same posting multiple times.

4. You agree not to use any obscene, indecent, or offensive language or to provide to or post on or through the Website any User Content that is defamatory, abusive, bullying, harassing, racist, hateful, violent, or that promotes any of the foregoing.

5. You further agree not to use any sexually explicit language or to provide to or post on or through the Website any graphics, text, photographs, images, video, audio or other material that is sexually explicit or otherwise objectionable in nature.

6. The Website may contain certain graphics, text, photographs, images, video, audio, software, code, and other material that is provided by Further or its licensors and is not clearly identified as, or intended, for your use, including without limitation the organization, design, compilation, and “look and feel” of the Website (“Website Content”). The Website Content is protected by state, federal and international copyright, trademark and other intellectual property laws, and is the property of Further or its licensors. The copying, reproduction, publication, display, rearrangement, redistribution, modification, revision, alteration, cropping, re-sizing, reverse engineering, movement, removal, deletion, or other use or change by you, directly or indirectly, of any such Website Content, including but not limited to the removal or alteration of advertising, is strictly prohibited.

7. You acknowledge that Further has not reviewed and does not endorse the content of all sites linked to from the Website and is not responsible for the content or actions of any other sites linked to from the Website. Your following of any link to any service or site outside of Further is at your sole risk.

8. You agree that your use of the Website will not violate any contractual or fiduciary obligations you have to third parties, including that you will not transmit the private, confidential, trade secret, trade mark, proprietary or other non-public information of any other party through the Website.

9. You will not use the Website for commercial purposes unless you receive prior written authorization from Further to do so.

Monitoring:
Further may, but shall not be obligated to, monitor activity in some of the Website to review compliance with this terms.  All users of the Website hereby specifically agree to such monitoring. Nevertheless, Further does not make any warranties or guarantees that: (a) the Website, or any portion thereof, are monitored for accuracy, appropriateness, or unacceptable use, (b) apparent statements of fact have been or will be authenticated, or (c) we will take any specific action (or any action at all) in the event of a dispute regarding compliance or non-compliance with these terms.

Comments by Others are Not Endorsed by Further:
Further does not endorse, support, sanction, encourage, verify, or agree with the User Content, including comments, opinions, or statements posted on the Website. Any information or material placed in the Website, including advice and opinions, are the views and responsibility of those who post the statements and do not represent the views of Further or its third party service providers. You agree that Further and its third party service providers are not responsible, and shall have no liability to you, with respect to any User Content, information or materials posted by others, including defamatory, offensive or illicit material, even material that violates these terms.

Editing and Deletions:
Further reserves the right, but undertakes no duty, to review, edit, move or delete any material provided for display or placed on the Website, in its sole discretion, without notice. 

Products or Services Referenced on or through the Website :
Neither Further nor its third party service providers make any warranties, nor does it or they provide any recommendations or endorsements, with respect to any of the products and/or services referenced or mentioned in User Content in Website. You agree that Further and its third party service providers are not responsible, and shall have no liability to you, with respect to products, and/or services referenced or mentioned in the Website, including illegal, offensive or illicit items.

Products or Services Sold Through the Website :
Further Products or Services sold through the Website or any authorized distributor are not intended to diagnose, cure, or treat any medical or other health condition. You must be at least eighteen (18) years old to purchase Further Products or Services from the Website.

Shipping Policy:
Further will do its very best to ship all products ordered on Website or through a third party distributor immediately after receiving the order. Allow 3-8 business days for delivery for orders in the US and 10-21 business days for international deliveries. Further shall determine the most efficient shipping for your order.

Return/Refund Policy:
Further will offer a 100% money back guarantee on every Further Product purchased either directly through the Website or any other authorized distributor. To obtain a refund, you must notify Further immediately via email at wecare@furtherfood.com no later than 15 days after purchase that you will be seeking a refund. You must return the container to Further with a copy of your receipt within 30 days of purchase. In no event does any replacement or refund constitute an admission of any kind by Further.

Advertisements :
Further disclaims all liability for any advertisements that you may receive or any actions that you may take or refrain from taking as a result of any advertisement directed to you through the Website.  It is solely your responsibility for assessing and verifying the identity and trustworthiness of the source and content of any such advertisement.  Further assumes no responsibility for verifying, and makes no representations or warranties regarding, the identity or trustworthiness of the source or content of any advertisement.  In particular, Further assumes no responsibility and makes no representations or warranties regarding any advertisements related to the provision of health care or medical advice or clinical treatment, including, but not limited to, medical information, dietary or nutritional guidance, medical research, clinical material, prescriptive device or drug information.

Promotions:
From time to time, Further may run promotions or giveaways on its social media, online or through other means, including mailers or postcards included in product packaging (Promotions). NO PURCHASE OR PAYMENT OF ANY KIND IS NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN THE PROMOTIONS. A purchase will not improve chances of winning. 

All promotions are only open to residents of the United States who are at least 21 years of age or older upon the date of entry. Promotions are void where prohibited or regulated by law. By entering you agree to be bound and subject to these rules. Any violation of these rules may result in disqualification. All decisions are final and binding in all respects. All Promotions are subject to all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations.

Winner Selection: Winner selection will be conducted by random drawing from all eligible entries. Any potential winner will be notified by Direct Messaging on Instagram, directly from @Furtherfood. Do not disclose your personal information to anyone other than @Furtherfood.

Content and Release: By entering a Promotion, each entrant releases and discharges Further. affiliated entities, and each of their respective officers, directors, members, shareholders, employees, independent contractors, agents, representatives, successors and assigns, from any and all liability whatsoever in connection with the Promotion, including, without limitation, legal claims, costs, injuries, losses or damages, demands or actions of any kind (including, without limitation, personal injuries, death, damage to, loss or destruction or property, rights of publicity or privacy, defamation, or portrayal in a false light) (collectively, “Claims”). Except where prohibited: (i) entry into a Promotion constitutes the consent of the entrant, without further compensation, to use his/her name, likeness, biographical data, and contact information (including any email address provided by entrant) for editorial, advertising, marketing, publicity, and administrative purposes by Further (ii) acceptance of a prize constitutes a release by any winner of Further of any and all Claims in connection with the administration of the Promotion.

Disclaimer of Warranty. Limitation of Liabilities. Medical and Clinical Information:
Through the Website, Further will provide you with a variety of content, products, and a variety of interactive areas. Further may modify, revise or discontinue any content, product, feature or service of the Website with or without prior notice. Further does not warrant that its Website will be uninterrupted or free from security breaches, errors, data loss, and other technical complications. Use of Further and the Website are at your sole risk, as they are made available to you “as is” and “as available”, without any express or implied warranties including, but not limited to, merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose.

TO THE EXTENT NOT PROHIBITED BY LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL FURTHER BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR ANY INJURY OR DAMAGE, PHYSICAL OR MONETARY, IN RELATION TO YOUR USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE WEBSITE, REGARDLESS OF THE THEORY OF LIABILITY.  ANY MONETARY LOSS RESULTING FROM YOUR RELIANCE UPON INFORMATION OR DATA RECEIVED ON OR THROUGH THE WEBSITE IS STRICTLY YOUR SOLE RISK, RESPONSIBILITY AND LIABILITY.  IN PARTICULAR, ANY PERSONAL INJURY OR DEATH RESULTING FROM THE PROHIBITED RELIANCE ON MEDICAL OR CLINICAL INFORMATION ATTAINED THROUGH A THIRD PARTY ACQUIRED BY WAY OF THE WEBSITE IS SOLELY YOUR RISK, RESPONSIBILITY AND LIABILITY.  FURTHER DOES NOT WARRANT AS TO THE ACCURACY, COMPLETENESS, OR SUITABILITY OF ANY MEDICAL INFORMATION, ANY RESEARCH AND CLINICAL MATERIAL PUBLISHED OR MADE AVAILABLE FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES THROUGH THE WEBSITE.  YOU ARE ENCOURAGED AND ADVISED TO CONFIRM THE INFORMATION WITH OTHER SOURCES.  ANY AND ALL MEDICAL OR CLINICAL INFORMATION RECEIVED OR ACQUIRED THROUGH THE WEBSITE, IS NOT INTENDED AS A REPLACEMENT OR SUBSTITUTE OF YOUR MEDICAL OR CLINICAL JUDGMENT OR THAT OF YOUR PHYSICIAN OR OTHER HEALTH CARE PROVIDER.  IN NO EVENT SHALL FURTHER BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR ANY DAMAGES RELATED TO OR ARISING FROM YOUR USE OF THE WEBSITE.

INDEMNITY AND WAIVER:  YOU AGREE, THROUGH YOUR USE OF THE WEBSITE, TO HOLD HARMLESS, INDEMNIFY AND DEFEND FURTHER AND ITS AFFILIATES, OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AND AGENTS, FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL CLAIMS OR DEMANDS, MADE BY ANY THIRD PARTY DUE TO OR ARISING DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY OUT OF YOUR CONDUCT OR IN CONNECTION WITH YOUR USE OF THE WEBSITE OR ANY ADVERTISEMENT, ANY ALLEGED VIOLATION OR BREACH OF THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, OR ANY ALLEGED VIOLATION OF ANY APPLICABLE LAW OR REGULATION. YOU ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT YOU CANNOT SUE OR RECOVER ANY DAMAGES FROM FURTHER FOOD OR ITS AFFILIATES, OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AND AGENTS AS A RESULT OF THE DENIAL TO PROCESS ANY INFORMATION, SUSPENSION OR TERMINATION OF YOUR USE OR ACCESS TO THE WEBSITE, OR ANY ACTION TAKEN UPON AN ALLEGED VIOLATION, WITH OR WITHOUT PROVIDING NOTIFICATION TO YOU.

Intellectual Property:

Property of Further and its Affiliates :  You understand and agree that Further or its Affiliates (“Affiliates” shall mean any entity who directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control with such entity), partners and licensors own all right, title, and interest in the intellectual property related to the Website and Further, including, without limitation, all trademarks, trade names, copyrights, logos, graphics, software, data and documentation. You also agree not to decompile, disassemble, reverse engineer, modify, copy, relicense, resell, rent, transfer, remove or export any software owned by Further, its Affiliates or agents.  Unless you receive prior written consent from Further, you are not permitted to use or reproduce any intellectual property owned by Further, its Affiliates or agents.  Your use of any content by way of the Website or Further is through a non-exclusive right to use subject to the terms of these Terms and Conditions.  Any use other than the intended use is prohibited and may subject you to civil and criminal penalties.

Property of Third Parties :
You understand that Further may display or use other trademarks, trade names, copyrights, logos, or graphics owned by other copyright holders, for which Further has obtained permission.  You are not granted any right or license to use any of the aforementioned copyrighted material of third parties by virtue of you having access to the Website and Further.

Copyright Complaints:
Further respects the intellectual property of others, and we ask our users to do the same. Further may, in appropriate circumstances and at its discretion, suspend or terminate the access of and take other action against users, subscribers, registrants and account holders who infringe the copyright rights of others.

If you believe that your work has been copied and is accessible on or through the Website in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, or that the Website contains links or other references to another online location that contains material or activity that infringes your copyright rights, you should notify Further via email.

Inappropriate Content :
Through use of the Website, you may encounter material or language that you deem inappropriate, offensive or objectionable. You understand that the foregoing may occur and your use of the Website is at your sole risk, and Further will not be liable to you for any such content.

Privacy :
Further may collect and use certain information about you and your use of the Website and Further.  For more information: https://www.furtherfood.com/privacy/.

Termination or Suspension of Access:
Further reserves the right to terminate or suspend, at any time and effective immediately, your access to the Website.

Entire Agreement :
These Terms and Conditions (including the Privacy Policy) reflect the entire agreement between you and Further regarding the subject matter hereof, and supersedes all prior agreements between the parties, whether written (including electronic) or oral.

Modifications :
Further may, in its sole discretion, modify or revise these Terms and Conditions at any time, and you agree to be bound by such modifications or revisions. Continued access of the Website by you will constitute your acceptance of any modifications or revisions to these Terms and Conditions.  

Governing Law :
Your use of the Website shall be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of California, without giving effect to the conflict of law principles thereof.

Assignment :
Further may assign, license, transfer or subcontract any of its rights and/or responsibilities under these Terms and Conditions at any time.  You may not assign, license, transfer or subcontract any of your rights or obligations under these Terms and Conditions without Further’s express written consent.

Inquiries :
Please direct any questions to: editorial@furtherfood.com.  

Last Updated:  November 16, 2021

Expert Spotlight Maria Emmerich
